verses.kjv: If thou wilt return, O Israel, saith the LORD, return unto me: and if thou wilt put away thine abominations out of my sight, then shalt thou not remove.
verses.web: “If you will return, Israel,” says LORD, “if you will return to me, and if you will put away your abominations out of my sight; then you will not be removed;
verses.ct: "If you will come back, Israel," says the LORD, "come back to me. If you remove your disgusting idols from my sight, you won't be driven from your land.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt swear, The LORD liveth, in truth, in judgment, and in righteousness; and the nations shall bless themselves in him, and in him shall they glory.
verses.web: and you will swear, ‘As LORD lives,’ in truth, in justice, and in righteousness. The nations will bless themselves in him, and they will glory in him.”
verses.ct: Then when you swear, 'As the LORD lives,' you will mean it — with truth, justice, and righteousness. And the nations will find blessing through him and take pride in him."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD to the men of Judah and Jerusalem, Break up your fallow ground, and sow not among thorns.
verses.web: For LORD says to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem, “Break up your fallow ground, and don’t sow among thorns.
verses.ct: The LORD says this to the people of Judah and Jerusalem: "Plow up the hard ground of your hearts. Don't plant your seeds among thorns.

verses.kjv: Circumcise yourselves to the LORD, and take away the foreskins of your heart, ye men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem: lest my fury come forth like fire, and burn that none can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.
verses.web: Circumcise yourselves to LORD, and take away the foreskins of your heart, you men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem; lest my wrath go out like fire, and burn so that no one can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.
verses.ct: Dedicate yourselves to the LORD and strip away the stubbornness from your hearts, you people of Judah and Jerusalem. If you don't, my fury will blaze out like fire — a fire no one can put out — because of the evil things you've done."

verses.kjv: Declare ye in Judah, and publish in Jerusalem; and say, Blow ye the trumpet in the land: cry, gather together, and say, Assemble yourselves, and let us go into the defenced cities.
verses.web: Declare in Judah, and publish in Jerusalem; and say, ‘Blow the trumpet in the land!’ Cry aloud and say, ‘Assemble yourselves! Let’s go into the fortified cities!’
verses.ct: Announce it throughout Judah! Proclaim it in Jerusalem! Say, "Sound the trumpet across the land!" Shout it out: "Gather together! Let's retreat into the fortified cities!"

verses.kjv: Set up the standard toward Zion: retire, stay not: for I will bring evil from the north, and a great destruction.
verses.web: Set up a standard toward Zion. Flee for safety! Don’t wait; for I will bring evil from the north, and a great destruction.”
verses.ct: Raise a signal flag pointing toward Zion! Run for your lives — don't wait! Because I am bringing disaster from the north, and it will bring terrible destruction.

verses.kjv: The lion is come up from his thicket, and the destroyer of the Gentiles is on his way; he is gone forth from his place to make thy land desolate; and thy cities shall be laid waste, without an inhabitant.
verses.web: A lion has gone up from his thicket, and a destroyer of nations. He is on his way. He has gone out from his place, to make your land desolate, that your cities be laid waste, without inhabitant.
verses.ct: A lion has crept out of its hiding place — a destroyer of nations is on the march. He has left his homeland to turn your country into a wasteland. Your cities will be left in ruins, with no one living in them.

verses.kjv: For this gird you with sackcloth, lament and howl: for the fierce anger of the LORD is not turned back from us.
verses.web: For this, clothe yourself with sackcloth, lament and wail; for the fierce anger of LORD hasn’t turned back from us.
verses.ct: So put on sackcloth, weep and wail, because the fierce anger of the LORD has not turned away from us.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass at that day, saith the LORD, that the heart of the king shall perish, and the heart of the princes; and the priests shall be astonished, and the prophets shall wonder.
verses.web: “It will happen at that day,” says LORD, “that the heart of the king will perish, along with the heart of the princes. The priests will be astonished, and the prophets will wonder.”
verses.ct: "When that day comes," says the LORD, "the king will lose all courage, and so will the officials. The priests will be horrified, and the prophets will be stunned."

verses.kjv: Then said I, Ah, Lord GOD! surely thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall have peace; whereas the sword reacheth unto the soul.
verses.web: Then I said, “Ah, Lord LORD! Surely you have greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, ‘You will have peace;’ whereas the sword reaches to the heart.”
verses.ct: Then I said, "Oh, Lord GOD! You have completely deceived this people and Jerusalem by telling them, 'You will have peace,' while the sword is already at their throats!"

verses.kjv: At that time shall it be said to this people and to Jerusalem, A dry wind of the high places in the wilderness toward the daughter of my people, not to fan, nor to cleanse,
verses.web: At that time it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem, “A hot wind from the bare heights in the wilderness toward the daughter of my people, not to winnow, nor to cleanse;
verses.ct: At that time, this message will be spoken to the people of Jerusalem: "A scorching wind is blowing from the barren hills of the wilderness toward my people — not a gentle breeze for winnowing or cleaning grain,

verses.kjv: Even a full wind from those places shall come unto me: now also will I give sentence against them.
verses.web: a full wind from these will come for me. Now I will also utter judgments against them.”
verses.ct: but a wind far too strong for that. It comes at my command. Now I will pronounce judgment against them."

verses.kjv: Behold, he shall come up as clouds, and his chariots shall be as a whirlwind: his horses are swifter than eagles. Woe unto us! for we are spoiled.
verses.web: Behold, he will come up as clouds, and his chariots will be as the whirlwind. His horses are swifter than eagles. Woe to us! For we are ruined.
verses.ct: Look — the enemy advances like storm clouds! His chariots roar like a whirlwind, and his horses are faster than eagles. We're doomed! We are ruined!

verses.kjv: O Jerusalem, wash thine heart from wickedness, that thou mayest be saved. How long shall thy vain thoughts lodge within thee?
verses.web: Jerusalem, wash your heart from wickedness, that you may be saved. How long will your evil thoughts lodge within you?
verses.ct: Jerusalem, scrub the wickedness from your heart so you can be saved! How long will you let these evil schemes fester inside you?

verses.kjv: For a voice declareth from Dan, and publisheth affliction from mount Ephraim.
verses.web: For a voice declares from Dan, and publishes evil from the hills of Ephraim:
verses.ct: A voice shouts a warning from Dan, and from the hills of Ephraim comes news of disaster.

verses.kjv: Make ye mention to the nations; behold, publish against Jerusalem, that watchers come from a far country, and give out their voice against the cities of Judah.
verses.web: “Tell the nations, behold, publish against Jerusalem, ‘Watchers come from a far country, and raise their voice against the cities of Judah.
verses.ct: "Tell the nations! Announce it against Jerusalem: besiegers are coming from a distant land, raising their war cries against the cities of Judah.

verses.kjv: As keepers of a field, are they against her round about; because she hath been rebellious against me, saith the LORD.
verses.web: As keepers of a field, they are against her all around, because she has been rebellious against me,’ ” says LORD.
verses.ct: They surround her like guards watching a field, because she has rebelled against me," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thy way and thy doings have procured these things unto thee; this is thy wickedness, because it is bitter, because it reacheth unto thine heart.
verses.web: “Your way and your doings have brought these things to you. This is your wickedness; for it is bitter, for it reaches to your heart.”
verses.ct: "Your own choices and your own actions have brought this on you. This is the fruit of your wickedness — how bitter it is, how deeply it cuts into your heart."

verses.kjv: My bowels, my bowels! I am pained at my very heart; my heart maketh a noise in me; I cannot hold my peace, because thou hast heard, O my soul, the sound of the trumpet, the alarm of war.
verses.web: My anguish, my anguish! I am pained at my very heart! My heart trembles within me. I can’t hold my peace, because you have heard, O my soul, the sound of the trumpet, the alarm of war.
verses.ct: The pain, the pain! I'm doubled over in agony! My heart is pounding inside me — I can't stay silent! Because I've heard it, my soul has heard the trumpet blast, the alarm of war.

verses.kjv: Destruction upon destruction is cried; for the whole land is spoiled: suddenly are my tents spoiled, and my curtains in a moment.
verses.web: Destruction on destruction is decreed, for the whole land is laid waste. Suddenly my tents are destroyed, and my curtains gone in a moment.
verses.ct: Disaster crashes upon disaster — the whole land is devastated. In an instant my tents are destroyed, my shelters torn apart in a moment.

verses.kjv: How long shall I see the standard, and hear the sound of the trumpet?
verses.web: How long will I see the standard and hear the sound of the trumpet?
verses.ct: How long must I see the battle flags and hear the trumpet's call?

verses.kjv: For my people is foolish, they have not known me; they are sottish children, and they have none understanding: they are wise to do evil, but to do good they have no knowledge.
verses.web: “For my people are foolish. They don’t know me. They are foolish children, and they have no understanding. They are skillful in doing evil, but they don’t know how to do good.”
verses.ct: "My people are fools — they don't know me at all. They are senseless children with no understanding. They're experts at doing evil, but they have no idea how to do good."

verses.kjv: I beheld the earth, and, lo, it was without form, and void; and the heavens, and they had no light.
verses.web: I saw the earth, and, behold, it was waste and void, and the heavens, and they had no light.
verses.ct: I looked at the earth, and it was formless and empty. I looked at the heavens, and their light was gone.

verses.kjv: I beheld the mountains, and, lo, they trembled, and all the hills moved lightly.
verses.web: I saw the mountains, and behold, they trembled, and all the hills moved back and forth.
verses.ct: I looked at the mountains, and they were shaking. All the hills were swaying back and forth.

verses.kjv: I beheld, and, lo, there was no man, and all the birds of the heavens were fled.
verses.web: I saw, and behold, there was no man, and all the birds of the sky had fled.
verses.ct: I looked, and there wasn't a single person anywhere. Every bird in the sky had fled.

verses.kjv: I beheld, and, lo, the fruitful place was a wilderness, and all the cities thereof were broken down at the presence of the LORD, and by his fierce anger.
verses.web: I saw, and behold, the fruitful field was a wilderness, and all its cities were broken down at the presence of LORD, before his fierce anger.
verses.ct: I looked, and the fertile land had become a desert. Every city in it lay in ruins before the LORD, crushed by his fierce anger.

verses.kjv: For thus hath the LORD said, The whole land shall be desolate; yet will I not make a full end.
verses.web: For LORD says, “The whole land will be a desolation; yet I will not make a full end.
verses.ct: The LORD says this: "The whole land will become a wasteland, but I will not destroy it completely.

verses.kjv: For this shall the earth mourn, and the heavens above be black: because I have spoken it, I have purposed it, and will not repent, neither will I turn back from it.
verses.web: For this the earth will mourn, and the heavens above be black, because I have spoken it. I have planned it, and I have not repented, neither will I turn back from it.”
verses.ct: Because of this, the earth will mourn and the skies above will turn black. I have spoken, I have made my decision, and I will not repent or turn back from it."

verses.kjv: The whole city shall flee for the noise of the horsemen and bowmen; they shall go into thickets, and climb up upon the rocks: every city shall be forsaken, and not a man dwell therein.
verses.web: Every city flees for the noise of the horsemen and archers. They go into the thickets, and climb up on the rocks. Every city is forsaken, and not a man dwells therein.
verses.ct: At the thunder of horsemen and archers, every city empties out. People dive into the thickets and scramble up the rocks. Every town is abandoned — not a single person stays behind.

verses.kjv: And when thou art spoiled, what wilt thou do? Though thou clothest thyself with crimson, though thou deckest thee with ornaments of gold, though thou rentest thy face with painting, in vain shalt thou make thyself fair; thy lovers will despise thee, they will seek thy life.
verses.web: You, when you are made desolate, what will you do? Though you clothe yourself with scarlet, though you deck yourself with ornaments of gold, though you enlarge your eyes with makeup, you make yourself beautiful in vain. Your lovers despise you. They seek your life.
verses.ct: And you, devastated one — what will you do then? Even if you dress yourself in scarlet, drape yourself in gold jewelry, and paint your eyes with makeup, you'll make yourself beautiful for nothing. Your lovers despise you — they want you dead.

verses.kjv: For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail, and the anguish as of her that bringeth forth her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion, that bewaileth herself, that spreadeth her hands, saying, Woe is me now! for my soul is wearied because of murderers.
verses.web: For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail, the anguish as of her who gives birth to her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion, who gasps for breath, who spreads her hands, saying, “Woe is me now! For my soul faints before the murderers.”
verses.ct: I hear a cry like a woman in labor, the anguish of a mother delivering her first child. It's the voice of Jerusalem, gasping for breath, reaching out her hands and crying, "I can't take any more! My soul is overwhelmed — the killers are closing in!"
